alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Jefferson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 02 at 1:50PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Big Bend Florida, including the following counties, Franklin, Jefferson and Wakulla. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 150 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Carrabelle, Eastpoint, Apalachicola, Franklin, Turkey Point, Saint Teresa, Mcintyre, Curtis Mill, Alligator Point, Panacea-Wakulla Airport, Lanark Village, Panacea, Bald Point, Spring Creek, Carrabelle Beach, Yent Place, Shell Point, Liveoak Island, Wakulla Beach and Royal Bluff. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
